title: Norwegian Ski Federation
text:
The Norwegian Ski Federation () is headquartered in <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a> and is the national representative of the <a href="International%20Ski%20Federation">International Ski Federation</a>.
Founded on 21 February 1908, it covers the skiing disciplines of <a href="alpine%20skiing">alpine</a>, <a href="cross-country%20skiing%20%28sport%29">cross-country</a>, <a href="freestyle%20skiing">freestyle</a>, <a href="Nordic%20combined">Nordic combined</a>, <a href="ski%20jumping">ski jumping</a>, and <a href="snowboarding">snowboarding</a>. The organization is also involved in the promotion of skiing in Norway, cooperating with the <a href="Association%20for%20the%20Promotion%20of%20Skiing">Association for the Promotion of Skiing</a>.
The current president is <a href="Erik%20R%C3%B8ste">Erik Røste</a>, and vice president is Kristin Vestgren Sæterøy.
